definition:
A non-degenerate sesquilinear form $b:V\times V\rightarrow k$ is
*reflexive* if for all $v,w\in V$, if $b(v,w)=0$ then $b(w,v)=0$. This
means $$v\perp w\textnormal{ if and only if } w\perp v.$$ It is rare to
define perpendicularity for sesquilinear/bilinear maps which are not
reflexive because it would require a version of left and right
perpendicular. Thus a reflexive sesquilinear/bilinear map is usually
synonymous with the existence of perpendicularity.
